intro: Hieracium colophyllum, commonly known as the sandhill hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in open areas such as prairies and disturbed sites. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
